00022 /**
00023  * @file   IterPlier.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Thu Aug 25 15:09:01 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief  Class containing methods to iteratively call
00028  *         plier to improve results.
00029  */
00030 
00031 #ifndef ITERPLIER_H
00032 #define ITERPLIER_H
00033 
00034 //
00035 #include "plier/affyplier.h"

00037 #include "stats/stats.h"

00039 #include <algorithm>

00044 /**
00045  * @class IterPlier
00046  * @brief Runs plier() interatively using the "best" features in each
00047  *        iteration, currently the features most correlated with the initial
00048  *        target signal estimates.
00049  */
00050 class IterPlier {
00051 
00052 public :
00053     static const int noData = -10000;
00054   /** 
00055    * Constructor. Create our own local memory caches.
00056    * 
00057    * @param maxFeature - Maximum initial number of features, if more features
00058    * are needed internal buffers will automatically be enlarged.
00059    * @param maxChip - Maximum initial number of chips, if more chips are needed
00060    * internal buffers will automatically be enlarged.
00061    */
00062   IterPlier();
00063   IterPlier(int chip_cnt,int feature_cnt);
00064 
00065   /** 
00066    * Clean up the local memory caches.
00067    */
00068   ~IterPlier();
00069 
00070 private:
00071   void memZap();
00072   void memFree();
00073   void memAlloc(int chip_cnt,int feature_cnt);
00074 
00075 public:
00076   void memEnsureSize(int chip_cnt,int feature_cnt);
00077 
00078   /** 
00079    * Iteratively call plier decreasing the number of features by selecting those
00080    * that are most correlated with the target response from the previous
00081    * iteration. 
00082    * 
00083    * @param plier - plier object with parameters already set.
00084    * @param atomCount - Number of atoms. Indicates feature pairs, length of featureRespons,
00085    *                    and number columns in pm & mm matrices.
00086    * @param chipCount - Number of experiments. Indicates the hybridizations, length of
00087    *                    targetResponse and number of rows in pm & mm matrices.
00088    * @param pm - Matrix of perfect match feature intensities (chipCount rows and atomCount cols);
00089    * @param mm - Matrix of background feature intensities (chipCount rows and atomCount cols);
00090    * @param targetResponse - Where signal estimates will be filled in.
00091    * @param featureResponse - Where feature effects will be filled in.
00092    * @param residuals - Residuals left after fitting.
00093    * @param atomUsed - Array of length atomCount indicating features used for final fit.
00094    * @param iterCount - Number of additional iterations of plier to do.
00095    * @param iterFeature - Number of features each iteration after initial plier call. e.g iterCount = 2,
00096    *                      and iterFeature = 22,11
00097    * @return long plier errorcode.
00098    */
00099   long runCorrIterPlier(caffyplier &plier,
00100                         int atomCount,
00101                         int chipCount, 
00102                         double** pm, 
00103                         double **mm,
00104                         double *targetResponse, 
00105                         double *featureResponse,
00106                         double **residuals,
00107                         int *atomUsed, 
00108                         int iterCount,
00109                         int *iterFeature);
00110 
00111 private :
00112   /* Try not to allocate memory every time called. */
00113   double **m_pm;  ///< Perfect match matrix to fill in for calling plier iteratively.
00114   double **m_mm;  ///< Mismatch matrix to fill in for calling plier iteratively.
00115   double *m_featureResponse; ///< Feature Response array for calling plier iteratively.
00116   double *m_targetResponse;  ///< Target response array for calling plier iteratively.
00117   //
00118   double **residuals;
00119 
00120   //
00121   int m_cntChip;
00122   int m_cntFeature;
00123   //
00124   int m_maxChip;    ///< Maximum number of chips that m_pm and m_mm can hold.
00125   int m_maxFeature; ///< Maximum number of features that m_pm and m_mm can hold;
00126 
00127   /** 
00128    * Run plier choosing only the featureNumToUse best correlated features
00129    * for the new target signal estimate. 
00130    * 
00131    * @param plier - plier object with parameters already set.
00132    * @param atomCount - Number of atoms. Indicates feature pairs, length of featureRespons,
00133    *                    and number columns in pm & mm matrices.
00134    * @param chipCount - Number of experiments. Indicates the hybridizations, length of
00135    *                    targetResponse and number of rows in pm & mm matrices.
00136    * @param pm - Matrix of perfect match feature intensities (chipCount rows and atomCount cols);
00137    * @param mm - Matrix of background feature intensities (chipCount rows and atomCount cols);
00138    * @param targetResponse - Where signal estimates will be filled in.
00139    * @param featureResponse - Where feature effects will be filled in.
00140    * @param residuals - Residuals left after fitting.
00141    * @param atomUsed - Array of length atomCount indicating features used for final fit.
00142    * @param featureNumToUse - Number of features to use for new estimate.
00143    * 
00144    * @return plier errorcode, zero on success.
00145    */
00146   long iterateCorrPlier(caffyplier &plier,
00147                         int atomCount,
00148                         int chipCount,
00149                         double** pm,
00150                         double **mm, 
00151                         double *targetResponse,
00152                         double *featureResponse, 
00153                         double **residuals,
00154                         int *atomUsed,
00155                         int featureToUse);
00156 
00157   /** Comparator struct for sorting. */
00158   struct less_pair : public binary_function< pair<int,double>, pair<int,double>, bool> {
00159 
00160     bool operator()(const pair<int, double> &x, const pair<int, double> &y) {     
00161     return x.second < y.second; }
00162   };
00163 
00164   /** 
00165    * Copy a column from the matrix formed by pm - mm to the array.
00166    * 
00167    * @param pm - perfect match matrix.
00168    * @param mm - mismatch (or background) matrix.
00169    * @param colIx - column to copy to array.
00170    * @param length - number of rows in matrix and length of array.
00171    * @param array - array to copy column into.
00172    */  
00173   void copyColumnToRow(double **pm, double **mm, int colIx, int length, double *array);
00174 };

00176 #endif /* ITERPLIER_H */
